text: it blows my mind every day that credit cards were *ever* a thing *anywhere*, nvm that they are still basically the only viable payment method for something like 95% of all transactions in the US.  Credit cards make absolutely no sense whatsoever... instead of inventing a secure payment method, they invented a bonkers payment method and then decided to rely on an entire industry of fraud detection stuff that siphons money from all those transactions... I wonder if this started out as a scam by the credit card companies in the first place, or if the people who invented the system were simply morons and the scam grew on top of it over time
